data.text:
1. S Jonas Ferdinand Gabriel Lippmann (August 16, 1845- July 13, 1921) Most of these pictures, taken while traveling, were developed on the mantel piece of a hotel room, which proves that the method is easy enough to carry out. - Lippman

2. Ethnic Background and History S Born to French parents in Hollerich, Luxembourg S His father was also a Physicist S Lived in Paris, France S He married a woman named Cherbuliez in 1888. S Author of two books, Cours de thermodynamique in 1886 and Cours d'acoustique et d'optique in 1888

3. Education S 1873, he went on a scientific mission to Heidelberg, Germany S Received his doctorate in philisophy S 1875, he then went to the University of Paris S 1883, he became a professor of mathematical physics at Paris's Faculty of Sciences laboratory.

4. Greatest Accomplishment/ Contributions S Greatest Accomplishment S Produced forever lasting color in photographs S Contributions S Developed a method to eliminate the personal equation measuring time by using photographic recording. S He studied the elimination of irregularities of pendulum clocks, designing a method to compare the oscillation time of two pendulums of an almost equal period. S He also made some ingenious improvements to numerous standard physics instruments.

5. Awards Recieved S Nobel Prize in Physics S Winning Work: Lippmann Plate- Method of reproducing colours photographically based on interference.

6. Illustrations S The capillary electrometer S Small electric currents are detected S The coelostat S Permitted long-exposure photographs of the sky
